Title: To Kill a Mockingbird
Author: Harper Lee
Summary: A coming-of-age story set in the American South, dealing with issues of race, class, and morality.

Author: George Orwell
Summary: A totalitarian regime uses surveillance, censorship, and propaganda to maintain control over the populace.

Title: Pride and Prejudice
Author: Jane Austen
Summary: A classic tale of love and misunderstandings between Elizabeth Bennet and Mr. Darcy.

Title: The Great Gatsby
Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
Summary: A story of wealth, love, and the American Dream, centered around the enigmatic Jay Gatsby.

Title: Moby Dick
Author: Herman Melville
Summary: The obsessive quest of Captain Ahab for revenge against the white whale Moby Dick.

Title: War and Peace
Author: Leo Tolstoy
Summary: A detailed chronicle of Russian society during the Napoleonic Era, focusing on five aristocratic families.

Title: Brave New World
Author: Aldous Huxley
Summary: A future society where people are genetically engineered and controlled through pleasure and conditioning.

Title: The Catcher in the Rye
Author: J.D. Salinger
Summary: A teenager, Holden Caulfield, navigates the challenges of adolescence and identity in New York City.

Title: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring
Author: J.R.R. Tolkien
Summary: The first part of an epic tale of a young hobbit’s journey to destroy a powerful ring.

Title: Crime and Punishment
Author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
Summary: The moral dilemmas faced by a young man who commits murder and grapples with guilt and redemption.

Title: The Hobbit
Author: J.R.R. Tolkien
Summary: A hobbit named Bilbo Baggins embarks on an unexpected adventure with a group of dwarves.

Title: The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn
Author: Mark Twain
Summary: A boy and a runaway slave travel down the Mississippi River, facing societal challenges and moral dilemmas.

Title: Jane Eyre
Author: Charlotte Brontë
Summary: An orphaned girl faces hardships and overcomes obstacles to find love and independence.

Title: Wuthering Heights
Author: Emily Brontë
Summary: A tale of passionate but doomed love set on the Yorkshire moors.

Title: Frankenstein
Author: Mary Shelley
Summary: A scientist creates a sentient being, leading to tragic consequences for both creator and creature.

Title: The Grapes of Wrath
Author: John Steinbeck
Summary: The struggles of a poor family migrating from the Dust Bowl to California during the Great Depression.

Title: The Alchemist
Author: Paulo Coelho
Summary: A shepherd boy’s journey to find a hidden treasure teaches him about life and following his dreams.

Title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
Author: Oscar Wilde
Summary: A young man’s portrait ages and bears the marks of his sins while he remains youthful and unmarked.

Title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
Author: J.K. Rowling
Summary: A young boy discovers he is a wizard and begins his education at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.

Title: The Road
Author: Cormac McCarthy
Summary: A father and son journey through a bleak, desolate world, struggling to survive.

Title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
Author: Gabriel García Márquez
Summary: The epic tale of the Buendía family in the fictional town of Macondo, blending reality with the fantastical.

Title: Anna Karenina
Author: Leo Tolstoy
Summary: The tragic story of a married woman’s affair with a count, set against the backdrop of Russian society.

Title: The Brothers Karamazov
Author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
Summary: A deep exploration of faith, doubt, and morality through the story of three brothers and their father’s murder.

Title: Dracula
Author: Bram Stoker
Summary: The story of Count Dracula’s attempt to move from Transylvania to England, and the efforts to stop him.

Title: The Stranger
Author: Albert Camus
Summary: A novel about an indifferent man who commits murder and faces the absurdity of life and justice.

Title: Lolita
Author: Vladimir Nabokov
Summary: The controversial story of a middle-aged man’s obsession with a 12-year-old girl.

Title: Beloved
Author: Toni Morrison
Summary: The haunting story of a runaway slave and the ghost of her dead daughter, exploring the legacy of slavery.

Title: Catch-22
Author: Joseph Heller
Summary: A satirical take on war and bureaucracy, centered around a group of American bomber pilots in WWII.

Title: Slaughterhouse-Five
Author: Kurt Vonnegut
Summary: The surreal experiences of a soldier who becomes “unstuck in time,” experiencing events out of sequence.

Title: Fahrenheit 451
Author: Ray Bradbury
Summary: A future society where books are banned and “firemen” burn them, focusing on one man’s awakening.

Title: Middlemarch
Author: George Eliot
Summary: A sprawling study of provincial life in 19th-century England, focusing on social and political issues.

Title: Don Quixote
Author: Miguel de Cervantes
Summary: The story of an aging man who, inspired by tales of chivalry, sets out as a knight to revive chivalry.

Title: The Divine Comedy
Author: Dante Alighieri
Summary: A spiritual journey through Hell, Purgatory, and Paradise, representing the soul’s path to God.

Title: The Metamorphosis
Author: Franz Kafka
Summary: A man wakes up one morning to find himself transformed into a giant insect, facing alienation and despair.

Title: The Handmaid's Tale
Author: Margaret Atwood
Summary: A future society where women are subjugated, focusing on the life of a “handmaid” used for reproduction.

Title: The Old Man and the Sea
Author: Ernest Hemingway
Summary: The story of an old Cuban fisherman’s epic struggle to catch a giant marlin and his battle with the sea.

Title: Ulysses
Author: James Joyce
Summary: A day in the life of Leopold Bloom in Dublin, paralleling Homer’s Odyssey in a stream-of-consciousness style.

Title: Heart of Darkness
Author: Joseph Conrad
Summary: A journey into the African Congo becomes a metaphorical exploration of colonialism and the human psyche.

Title: Great Expectations
Author: Charles Dickens
Summary: The story of an orphan named Pip and his growth, experiences, and moral development in Victorian England.

Title: Madame Bovary
Author: Gustave Flaubert
Summary: The story of a doctor's wife who, dissatisfied with her provincial life, seeks escape through affairs and luxury.

Title: A Tale of Two Cities
Author: Charles Dickens
Summary: A story of love, sacrifice, and redemption set against the backdrop of the French Revolution.

Title: The Count of Monte Cristo
Author: Alexandre Dumas
Summary: A man wrongfully imprisoned escapes and seeks revenge against those who betrayed him.

Title: The Sound and the Fury
Author: William Faulkner
Summary: A complex, multi-perspective narrative about the decline of the Compson family in the American South.

Title: The Sun Also Rises
Author: Ernest Hemingway
Summary: A post-WWI story of a group of expatriates in Europe, exploring themes of love, loss, and disillusionment.

Title: A Passage to India
Author: E.M. Forster
Summary: The tensions between the British and Indians during the British Raj, exploring race, religion, and friendship.

Title: Gulliver’s Travels
Author: Jonathan Swift
Summary: The adventures of Lemuel Gulliver in strange lands, satirizing human nature and society.

Title: Gone with the Wind
Author: Margaret Mitchell
Summary: The story of Scarlett O’Hara, a Southern belle, during the American Civil War and Reconstruction.

Title: Rebecca
Author: Daphne du Maurier
Summary: A young bride is haunted by the legacy of her husband’s first wife, Rebecca, at the mysterious Manderley estate.

Title: The Scarlet Letter
Author: Nathaniel Hawthorne
Summary: A woman in Puritan New England is shunned and forced to wear a scarlet “A” for adultery.

Title: The Catch-22
Author: Joseph Heller
Summary: A satirical look at the absurdities of war through the experiences of a WWII bomber squadron.
